title: Casino Tycoon (film)
text:
Casino Tycoon (賭城大亨之新哥傳奇) is a 1992 Hong Kong action drama film written, produced and directed by <a href="Wong%20Jing">Wong Jing</a> starring <a href="Andy%20Lau">Andy Lau</a>, <a href="Joey%20Wong">Joey Wong</a> and <a href="Chingmy%20Yau">Chingmy Yau</a>. The film is inspired by stories of <a href="Stanley%20Ho">Stanley Ho</a>, <a href="Henry%20Fok">Henry Fok</a> and <a href="Yip%20Hon">Yip Hon</a>. It was followed by the sequel "<a href="Casino%20Tycoon%202">Casino Tycoon 2</a>", which was released the same year.
Summary.
Set in <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>, "Casino Tycoon" chronicles the story of Benny, a young graduate played by Andy Lau, who flees Hong-Kong during the Japanese invasion and heads for gambling haven <a href="Macau">Macau</a>. Once in Macau, he starts as a lowly coolie but he impresses a local business man who has ties to organised crime, and slowly builds his way up the ranks. Benny engages in a battle of wits against his college rival and business enemies. In the finale, Benny overcomes his enemies but at great personal cost.
